result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brenda T Russell Bouchard was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Consecutive to: Case 13CT1194, if revoked.
Same conditions apply as to Extended Supervision if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs ($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of New Berlin Police Department.
Transcript fee ($24) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts and for Waukesha County District Attorney.
DNA surcharge ($250) is assessed.
Cash bail applied to Costs - PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Case 14TR 379 was dismissed and read in.

Count 3 is dismissed by operation of law.

Fine ($1,444) is assessed.  Cash bail applied to fine and balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with Standard Release Conditions.  Court will allow release to WCS for application to the Alcohol Treatment Court.
Consecutive to: Case 13CT1194.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brenda T Russell Bouchard in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  
Case called along with:  13CT1194 (OWI 3rd).
This case now becomes an OWI 4th.

Court addresses the preliminary hearing.
Defendant waives her rights to a preliminary hearing and requests to proceed to plea and sentencing.
Court finds enough probable cause to bind this matter over.

Defendant pleads Guilty of count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is Dismissed and Read-In.
Count 3 is Dismissed by Operation of Law.

Defendant's sponsor presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Count 2:
Consecutive to 13CT1194
Total Prison:  5.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2.5   Years.
Extended Supervision:  3.0 Years
Stayed
If revoked:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Term of Probation:   2.5  Years.
Conditions of Probation:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35    (paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of New Berlin Police Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee).
TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $24   (paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to District Attorney or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee).
FINE:  $ 1,444
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250 
Apply Bail and Balance can be paid as a condition of probation.

36  Months D/L REVOCATION -  Concurrent to any other revocation
36  MonthsIGNITION INTERLOCK

Condition Time:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Court will also allow release to WCS for application to the Alcohol Treatment Court.
Consecutive to 13CT1194

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

There is no objection by the defense.  The court accepts the filing and   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
